attributes.action: Introduce a 12-month residency requirement for candidates to Parliament
attributes.background: In order for Parliament to become truly representative, this petition proposes introducing legislation to require persons standing for Parliament to be resident in their constituency for at least 12 months prior to election day.
attributes.additional_details: The UK is meant to be a representative democracy.  However, parties will often choose a favoured member to run for a seat to maximise their chances of winning, even though they have no genuine connection to the local community.  As a result, Parliament is not a collection of community representatives, but a collection of preferred party members.

attributes.action: Extend the maximum length of a caravan towed by a 3.5 tonne vehicle from 7m
attributes.background: The current law stops you towing a caravan more than 7m long with anything less than 3.5 tonne vehicle when a lot of vehicles less than 3.5 tonne are capable of towing these caravans
attributes.additional_details: There seems to be more and more caravans now especially foreign caravans that are more than 7m long these can currently only be towed with a vehicle more than 3.5 tonne a lot of people still tow illegally with less than 3.5 tonne as most campsites don’t allow Comercial vehicles so this makes it hard to stay legal and still be able to enjoy using bigger family friendly caravans

attributes.action: Fund NHS continuing care for all older people.
attributes.background: Some older people are only entitled to 6 weeks free care and then they are made to pay. Care should be free for all older people.

attributes.action: Fund clinical trials in Alzheimer's based on the aldehyde toxicity hypothesis
attributes.background: There is increasing evidence to suggest Alzheimer's is caused by aldehyde toxicity. It stands to reason that medical protocol based on this hypothesis could be invaluable in the prevention and treatment of this devastating neurodegenerative condition afflicting the ageing population.
attributes.additional_details:
Public funding should be used to investigate a therapeutic cocktail of the following compounds in clinical trials to reduce the economic burden of Alzheimer's and dementia and improve quality of life in the ageing population:

N-acetylcysteine (NAC)
Niacin (nicotinic acid form)
Zinc
Molybdenum
Alpha lipoic acid
Selenium
Sulforaphane

Collectively, these compounds are integral in aldehyde detoxification and would present a powerful weapon against neurodegenerative disorders such as Alzheimer's.

attributes.action: Make it law for all restaurants to provide Braille menus.
attributes.background: Why should people not have the option to read a menu? Perhaps it's something that we sighted people take for granted. In order for visually impaired people to gain more independence, it's important that they're actually able to read a menu for themselves.

attributes.action: Require care providers and all staff to be qualified and registered
attributes.background: Care is in crisis. There are regular reports of older and vulnerable people being abused and neglected. Most carers are hard-working professionals, but to increase confidence and standards everyone in the care industry should be regulated.
attributes.additional_details: Staff at every level should be registered, increasing protection for the vulnerable but also placing carers on a professional footing. The cost of registration should be borne by providers. This register is not a criticism of hard-working care staff, and should increase their status and security, while registration of senior staff will enable them to be held accountable if they fail to provide good care.

attributes.action: Increase limit for when charities must have an independent review of accounts
attributes.background: I am involved with a charity which makes approximately £25-£30k per year, meaning we must have an independent review.  This cost us £2500 this year, which seems a disproportionately high percentage of our income.   Increasing the limit to £50k could help charities give more to the causes we support.
attributes.additional_details: According to gov.uk, there were approximately 58 thousand charities in the UK with income between £10k and £100k.  If we assume that these are evenly distributed across the range, around 16000 charities would benefit.  If their costs are similar to ours, that would be an extra £45k going to good cause each year.  While transparency is important, people give to small charities assuming the money goes to the cause they promote and 10% going to an auditor does not serve their expectations well.

attributes.action: Give the parents of twins or multiples maternity leave per child
attributes.background: Currently the parents of twins, triplets, quads etc. Only receive one years maternity leave for one parent. We feel parents should receive maternity leave per child.

attributes.action: To dedicate more resources to help men and young boys with mental health issues
attributes.background: As a young man, I’m scared to see statistics about male suicides. It is shocking that very little is being done to tackle the problem of mental health, and more needs to be done to help men and young boys with depression, anxiety and stress among with other issues
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.samaritans.org/about-us/our-research/facts-and-figures-about-suicide

https://www.telegraph.co.uk/men/thinking-man/11787304/Homelessness-is-a-gendered-issue-and-it-mostly-impacts-men.html

https://www.ons.gov.uk/peoplepopulationandcommunity/birthsdeathsandmarriages/deaths/bulletins/suicidesintheunitedkingdom/2016registrations#main-points

attributes.action: law to put panic buttons in hgv s incase drivers have medical emergency
attributes.background: Lots of drivers going missing and when found are deceased in their cabs, either unable to raise alarm of feeling unwell or no signal on phone etc

attributes.action: Increase funding for suicide research & offer specialist support to stop it.
attributes.background: As a mother raising children in the UK, I have a burning desire to find out why suicide is on the increase, especially amongst the male age group 18 - 49, support needs to be given to stop it & assistance mechanisms should be put in place to stop these unnecessary deaths.
attributes.additional_details: Suicide can happen to any family at anytime & it leaves them devastated. We need to reach out to those who are susceptible and ensure that they are able to get any assistance they need before they make the difficult choice to take their own life. It is a silent killer and more most be done so that individuals considering it are able to open up and discuss their problems rather than feel that suicide is the only option.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to send horses to slaughter.
attributes.background: I have volunteered at local riding schools for a number of years. Horses can be there as a companion for people who feel lonely. They can even be used to help restore confidence for disabled. Horses have been a vital part of our community’s and don’t deserve slaughter.
attributes.additional_details: Through this I have seen how therapeutic horses can be to people. Horses can help reduce stress levels and anxiety. The Riding for disabled (RDA) have used horses to help the disabled find something they can be good at so they don’t feel isolated. Horses were there for soldiers through the war and charged into battle bravely to save their rider and how do we repay them? We send them to slaughter. Thousands of horses are killed each year in UK slaughterhouses.

attributes.action: Ban the import and sale of badger hair in the UK.
attributes.background: Badger hair is often used in Britain because of certain water-retaining properties it has; however, the evidence is that animals suffer, at best, appalling living conditions, and at worst, terrible abuse and neglect, in order to produce this hair.
attributes.additional_details: Badger farms, predominantly in Asia, have been filmed keeping badgers in horrific conditions in order to produce hair for items like shaving brushes and paint brushes. When other options, like horse-hair, and artificial hair, is freely available, there is no reason to support this cruel industry in any way whatsoever, and the UK should take a lead in banning the use of this commodity.

attributes.action: Make School Meals More Affordable
attributes.background: I am concerned that some schools are charging exorbitant prices for School Meals which could easily prove costly for parents, long term. As a solution, I would like to see the Education Act amended to cap School Meal prices at a level affordable to low and middle-income earners.

attributes.action: Online retail companies should pay an equivalent to UK high street rates.
attributes.background:
The High Street is suffering, losing thousands of jobs because online suppliers offer low paid jobs in distribution centres that pay minimal local business rates.
 
Many pay low corporation tax and again gain an unfair advantage over British and other tax paying businesses
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2018/aug/02/amazon-halved-uk-corporation-tax-bill-to-45m-last-year
 
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-45053528
 
https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/amazon-now-pay-even-less-13023482
 
https://www.express.co.uk/news/uk/998509/amazon-uk-tax-high-street-shops-business-tax-income-tax-taxation-system
 
https://www.ft.com/content/8fcf026e-38e0-11e8-8b98-2f31af407cc8

attributes.action: The UK should agree to the UN's Global Compact for Migration
attributes.background: The Global Compact seeks to safeguard the rights of migrants and reduce the negative effects of sudden high levels of migration, partially by reducing the structural problems in countries that cause irregular migration.  The Compact is simply a framework for co operation and not legally binding.
attributes.additional_details:
Global Compact pdf - https://refugeesmigrants.un.org/sites/default/files/180713_agreed_outcome_global_compact_for_migration.pdf

UN brief description of Compact's aims: https://refugeesmigrants.un.org/migration-compact

attributes.action: Extend the CAMHS upper age limit to 21
attributes.background: Mental illnesses do not disappear at the age of 18, yet it seems that in the majority of cases, once they turn 18, vulnerable young people are discharged from CAMHS, regardless of their mental health situation, not knowing whether they'll be considered "ill enough" by adult mental health services.
attributes.additional_details:
CAMHS - child and adolescent mental health services
Currently discharge their patients at 18 regardless of whether they have recovered well enough or not. 
Even if the patient is referred to adult mental health services, 9 times out of 20 they're not considered "ill enough" to get help.
It's also very unsettling for a fragile young person to have to get used to a new key worker (if they do get accepted by adult services), when they have established a good relationship with their CAMHS worker

attributes.action: Make this country a true democracy.
attributes.background:
Voting for an MP or a political party involves compromise since it is unlikely that either will precisely represent an individual's views on a range of issues.
The technology now exists for people to vote easily on any popular issue but the government is currently able to ignore those wishes.
attributes.additional_details:
1)	Make the government e-petitions website more widely publicised on a regular basis, on TV for instance 
2)	Make it mandatory for the government to hold a referendum where any petition requesting a referendum exceeds 100,000 signatures
3)	Make all referendums available online
4)	Make the results of the referendums mandatory. The government MUST act on them.

attributes.action: Stop "Public Duty Cost Allowance" ex Prime ministers get £115,000 every year.
attributes.background:
Ex Prime ministers should not be getting an extra 5-6 times the national average wage! The public do not know how this money is being spent. 

Ex Prime Ministers spent £538,067 between them in 2016-17.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/tony-blair-one-million-taxpayer-claim-public-duty-cost-allowance-prime-minister-cabinet-office-a8616731.html
 
https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/647027/page_87_public_duty_cost_allowance.csv/preview
 
https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/nick-clegg-claims-annual-expenses-allowance-deputy-prime-minister-liberal-democrats-public-duty-cost-a8158781.html

attributes.action: The government should stop ALL foreign aid now!
attributes.background: Issues at home are more important.
attributes.additional_details:
Foreign aid is given to India and they have a space programme 
Foreign aid is given to Pakistan, where Christians have been persecuted
Money should be spent on the NHS, pensions, policing etc.

attributes.action: Raise awareness of early cancer symptoms among GPs
attributes.background: After recent family dealings with cancer and previous friends I have known dying from cancer it was evident that the GP's involved were at a loss to diagnose what was happening which may have contributed to the disease not being treated early enough resulting in prolonged suffering.
attributes.additional_details: The Government should provide more training on the symptoms and tests that can spot cancer early.

attributes.action: Stop the resale of concert tickets on secondary websites above face value price
attributes.background:
Concert tickets sell out within minutes due to use of specialist software purchasing them in mass.

New laws put in place earlier this year have seemingly made no difference.
attributes.additional_details:
Reselling football tickets is illegal under section 166 Criminal Justice and Public Order Act 1994. This prevents touts from buying and reselling at inflated prices. 

We need something similar for concert tickets. One option is to not allow secondary sites to resell concert tickets for more than the face value, excluding transaction fees and a small fee to ensure profit for the site. Selling at a highly inflated rate should not be allowed. It's unbeneficial for fans and the music business alike. 

The fan fair alliance goes into more detail on this - http://fanfairalliance.org/faqs/

attributes.action: Ban tenancies that require rent paid in advance for social housing
attributes.background: Becuase im on universal credit I have to pay £20 pound on top of my rent. Because my rent is meant to be paid in advance but the housing element is paid in arreas, and if I dont pay this I will be breaching my tenacy agreement, I want social housing to be banned from making tenancies like this.
attributes.additional_details: Or if they cant stop making tenancies like this make universal credit housing element paid weekly.

attributes.action: Reduce tax on fuel for the road haulage industry
attributes.background: Reduce fuel tax for the road haulage industry.
attributes.additional_details: Fuel is the biggest out may in road haulage. The cost is increasing and forcing small business into financial stuggle. The reduce in tax would encourage hauliers to expand and boost the economy. Increase wages run more fuel efficient/green vehicles

attributes.action: Stop charging students council tax on property rented for graduating year
attributes.background: Students are exempt from paying council tax however if a student is still living in student accommodation after they’ve graduated, they’re expected to pay the remaining months, even though their finically situation is still the same or most of the time, even worse.
attributes.additional_details: Contracts are only available for 12 months from most letting agents therefor trapping students into a fee that most of them can’t afford or have to pay with their student loan which is supposed to be used to help forward they’re education and living costs. We still have to pay this loan back and being forced to give a large amount of it away for a period of time in which you can’t control is very worrying. The exemption of students paying council tax should last their whole tenancy agreement.

attributes.action: Give nurses a better pay deal
attributes.background: Many nurses have been misled over how much they would receive as the result of the recent pay deal. Nurses had been told that they would get  least an immediate 3% pay rise but this is not what happened.
attributes.additional_details: Nurses were expecting a long-awaited and well-deserved pay rise but instead have been left disappointed and out of pocket.

attributes.action: Remove the 2 year restriction on a 125cc motorcycle upon completion of the CBT.
attributes.background: If you can ride a 125cc for 2 years why not permanently.

attributes.action: Make all goods vehicles to have speed limiters set at the national speed limit
attributes.background: Legislation needs to be in place making all goods vehicles speed limiters set at the national speed limit in order to reduce overtaking . At present hauliers set their vehicles at a speed of their choice. This causes bunching of LGV's and causes unnecessary overtaking .

attributes.action: Parents must be told if the other parent is convicted of child sex offenses
attributes.background: Parents must be told if their ex is convicted of child sex offenses, even if they don’t have contact with the children at that time.

attributes.action: Free dental treatment for steroid-dependant patients
attributes.background: Steroid-dependant patients need an exemption from paying for dental treatment. Addison’s disease sufferers are steroid dependant, which damages teeth and bones. We have no choice, it is just like a diabetic needing insulin, yet we have to pay dental costs and they don't.
attributes.additional_details:
More information is available at the Addison’s Support Group at www.addisons.org.uk
The British Dental Association will confirm steroids do cause damage to your teeth. 
It also affects our bones. Many of us suffer from osteoporosis too.

attributes.action: Review the act of rehoming lost dogs from 7 days to 28 days
attributes.background: 7 days does not give the owner time to come forward. Especially as there are certain legal procedures to follow. There is not enough information of what steps to take. The awaiting reports from vets and Dog wardens does not make the 7 day ruling realistic.
attributes.additional_details: When a family pet goes missing what steps do you take at this distressing time.? There should be a simple guideline, but also a time limit that reflects all the necessary searches and avenue's the distraught owner has to endure with  this very stressful ordeal. A plan of action put into place with a cap on fees. This would stop the monies being the incentive for unscrupulous organisations.

attributes.action: Increase the plastic packaging recycling&recovery target from 57% to 80% by 2020
attributes.background:
The Packaging Producer Responsibility Regulations framework is a positive step but targets do not reflect the urgency of our global plastic pollution crisis: producer target is 57% recycled or recovered by 2020. This is not enough.

https://www.gov.uk/guidance/packaging-producer-responsibilities
attributes.additional_details:
This petition is launching over Christmas 2018 where it still remains a challenge to participate in the gift giving tradition while avoiding single use plastics. 
Consumers need plastic free alternatives.
Excess plastic packaging engulfs our children's toys. 
Toy producers must be pressured to make urgent & significant changes necessary to protect our natural world.
The cheap price of plastic does not reflect the environmental cost. 
Producers profit whilst contributing to plastic pollution.

attributes.action: Stop the use of plastic milk bottles and return to glass bottles
attributes.background: Plastic milk bottles generate more toxic waste through recycling than the-using 100% recyclable glass milk bottles. Plastic milk bottles are just as bad as non-recyclable plastics and should be outlawed
attributes.additional_details: Refer to BBC program Blue Planet

attributes.action: Ban plastic toothbrushes and replace with Eco/environmental friendly ones
attributes.background: The biggest causes of pollution are factories, the burning of fossil fuels and of course plastics but the list of causes continues, we need to stop using plastic so much and replace it with environmental/Eco friendly products.
attributes.additional_details: With the removal of plastic toothbrushes from our country will NOT become an issue, plastic can easily be replaced with wooden brushes that can be recycled, or even better options such as Eco-friendly bags.Plastic causes damage to the environment; animals are suffering from the constant dumping of plastic, another is that sewage-system gets clogged the plastic form clumps with other waste and blocks water running, beautiful landscapes and habitats are destroyed. It is an open and shut case.

attributes.action: Reject the Brexit Deal agreed by Theresa May and reopen negotiations immediately
attributes.background: Theresa May and her followers have negotiated a very poor and unfair deal for the UK. Her misguided deal would mean Northern Ireland would have different trade rules than the UK (thus endangering the Union). We would also not be allowed to leave the Backstop (Protocol) without the EU's agreement.
attributes.additional_details:
This deal needs to be rejected by the British people. It does not allow us freedom from the EU and binds our hands. It even agrees to extending the transition period if agreement can't be reached! 
 
It doesn't matter what party you vote for, or whether you are a Brexiteer or a Remainer, EVERYONE who cares for this country has to vote against this awful deal + sign this petition. Read the deal yourself and you'll be shocked at how much sovereignty we'd be giving away. SAVE THE UK!

attributes.action: Give public vote on brexit either to accept the deal or leave with a no deal
attributes.background: We have voted to leave in a fair and democratic vote, we now need to vote on whether we agree with the governments deal to leave the EU or do we want to leave with a no deal

attributes.action: Posthumously award service medals to the now pardoned WW1 soldiers Shot at Dawn
attributes.background: In 2006 the UK govt granted a pardon to the 306 British soldiers shot at dawn for cowardice or desertion. Whilst that provided some closure for their families, I propose that their living relatives should now receive their service medals as they are as deserving as their fallen comrades.
attributes.additional_details: I walked from the UK to the grave of Stockton’s George Hunter in Esquelbecq, France to ensure that his memory was preserved. His story has been a focus of our commemoration in Stockton on tees and a source of immense comfort to his grand daughter. I believe that in the spirit of reconciliation and understanding she, and the families of the other shot at dawn soldiers should receive the medals that their ancestors earned in the conflict.

attributes.action: Initiate a Royal Commission examining Policing in the UK
attributes.background: Policing in the UK appears to be at crisis point- the last Royal Commision on Policing was held in 1962, over half a century ago. The policing landscape has significantly evolved in 56 years, and a review of policing practice in the UK is long overdue.

attributes.action: Reduce the fees of Universities from £9,250 back to £3000 per year
attributes.background:
The cost of university fees in the UK are unacceptable seeing as public universities are financed by the government. 
It's not fair for students from low socioeconomic backgrounds who struggle finaiacially and students from higher economic background to be expected to pay the same fee of £9,250.
attributes.additional_details:
most uni's in the EU are free ,however, what we are seeing is that Universities are continuing to increase their fees and reduce the grants available. The saddest issue here is all courses cost the same, that means a degree in nursing costs the same per year as denistry. 
As a result it's making higher education more attractive to students who can afford it and making it more difficult for students from deprived areas and low income families make it to uni's due to the fear of burdening loans.

attributes.action: Improve the assessment element of Personal Independence Payment
attributes.background:
Assessors training and knowledge is too generalised.
A common complaint with PIP assessments is that assessors cannot be trusted to record accurately what took place during the assessment.
Assessors also deal with a wide range of conditions and are not specialist to each individual condition.
attributes.additional_details: https://publications.parliament.uk/pa/cm201719/cmselect/cmworpen/829/82906.htm

attributes.action: Make it statutory that dogs dna can collected so that councils can fine owners
attributes.background: Dog mess is causing a huge issue in our community by those owners who don’t clear up after their dogs faeces.  It’s already illegal to not clear up after them however you have to be caught in the act.  Let’s empower our environmental officers to deal with this ever growing issue.

attributes.action: Require companies asking for experience to provide work experience to students
attributes.background: It is becoming harder and harder for students to get a work placement for work experience, and more and more companies are asking for experience for entry level positions. I propose that in order to ask for experience for entry level positions, you must provide it to students within reason.
attributes.additional_details:
https://talent.works/blog/2018/03/28/the-science-of-the-job-search-part-iii-61-of-entry-level-jobs-require-3-years-of-experience/ - Although this is an American article, it shows 61% of 'entry level' jobs require experience.

http://www.ukyouthparliament.org.uk/wp-content/uploads/Manifesto-2015-2016.pdf - Work Experience was one of the top four issues raised by 875,000 young people

https://www.theguardian.com/education/2014/may/23/my-son-keen-learn-struggling-find-work-experience - Old but true

attributes.action: Abolish NI contributions for working women caught in the State Pension Age trap.
attributes.background: Women born in the 1950's have been grievously impacted by the change in SPA and have to continue working. Many of these women have earned the full state pension entitlement by making 35+ years of National Insurance contributions. Such women should be exempt from making further NI contributions.
attributes.additional_details: As an example, take a woman born in 1953. She leaves school in 1970 and starts work full-time expecting to reach SAP in 2013 and retiring. By 2005 she has completed 35 years of work and is eligible for full State Pension. In 2011 she is told she has to work until the age of 66. By 2013 she has paid a total of 43 years of National Insurance contributions. Now she has to work a further 6 years and continue supporting a system that,by now, she thought would be supporting her.

attributes.action: Give an mandatory prison sentence after a death due to physical assault
attributes.background: My father was killed by a punch to the head in 2004 and has never received justice, the man who killed him received only community service as he done a plea bargain and admitted culpable homicide. If you hit someone and kill them it should be a mandatory prison sentence.
attributes.additional_details: No one should be able to enter a plea bargain if they hit someone and the person dies as a result. We all know right from wrong and if you kill someone then justice should serve an instant prison sentence whatever your intentions. We lost my father in 2004 and all the accused got was community service. Where's the justice in that? What does that mean for my poor father who dies of a single punch to the head? He ended up brain dead because of his injury. Help me to stop this.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for gambling companies to accept credit cards
attributes.background:
This petition is looking to tackle the problem of credit card use within the gambling industry.

The use of credit cards allows for a huge debt to be ran up without due diligence carried out.

There needs to be proper regulation on the source of funds used to gamble.

attributes.action: More effort to increase the peace process between Israel and Palestine
attributes.background: The UK Government should carry out a detailed review of all its efforts towards facilitating the peace process between Israel and Palestine. This review should identify what hasn’t been done and recommend new action that the Government could take.
attributes.additional_details: For so long people have seen these two states as enemies and for too long innocent people have been brought into a conflict which deeply effects the progression of life in this area of the world. It is time for this to stop.

attributes.action: We believe Wythenshawe Community Initiative deserves more funding
attributes.background: Wythenshawe Community Initiative are a child daycare centre that provide a safe space for children to play and be looked after, whilst parents are working. Everyday they have children and parents lining up to get a place in however many are turned away due to lack of funding and staff.
attributes.additional_details:
They are a non-profit organisation, based in Manchester and are for children from the ages of five to eleven. 

In 2017 they fundraised £3,498.52 but this is nowhere near enough to support the centre. Many children who turn up at the centre go without breakfast and staff struggle to provide them with enough food due to the lack of money.

attributes.action: Do not endorse Zimbabwe’s harmonised 2018 elections
attributes.background: There is growing evidence that the outcome of Zimbabwe’s harmonised elections was not a result of a free and fair electoral process. This was followed by post-election violence and the alleged slaughter and beatings of civilians by the army.
attributes.additional_details:
Abductions and an intensified crackdown on the opposition is ongoing.

As an activist, and with many Zimbabweans I am appealing to the UK parliament and government to: - suspend further economic, bilateral engagement with Zimbabwe's govt until there is clarity on its human rights situation; -recognise the unsafe political environment in Zimbabwe for opposition and activists; -strongly support concerns raised by EU, Zimbabwe Human Rights Groups and the USA on elections in Zimbabwe; put pressure on Zimbabwe's govt to account for the killing of innocent civilians by the army.

attributes.action: All English Local Authorities to notify residents by post of new Consultations
attributes.background: When introducing any legislation affecting residents, The Local Authority/Council must serve notice of any consultation or proposal directly on ALL residents, in additional languages if required, by way of postal service. Local Authorities across England are failing to comply with this requirement
attributes.additional_details: A specific example of this is the introduction of Selective Licensing in Luton, ALL residents in the affected areas have not been informed of the Consultation. The outcome of this consultation will affect all residents of Luton. We are asking for people across England to support this if they have had a similar experience with their Local Authority failing to consult with them on important changes affecting their town/city.

attributes.action: Murdered 4 y/o British national: Urge Pakistani government to deliver justice
attributes.background: This murder has been overlooked for 4 years. Shahryar Ahmad, a British national, was kidnapped outside his grandmother's home in Faisalabad, Pakistan on 21 August 2014, and subsequently murdered by the gang who abducted him.
attributes.additional_details: I, Iftkhar Ahmad, Shahryar's father,  was led to believe for almost 4 months that the kidnappers were holding him for ransom, however it was later discovered that my little boy’s body was found by the police, dumped in a canal a mere 2 days after his abduction. Justice has not been delivered to Shahryar or my family. Urgent intervention by the UK government and parliament is necessary.
